problem_text: (Simplest questions related to the Whitehead asphericity conjecture). Let ⟨x1, x2, x3 | r1, r2, r3⟩ be a presentation of the trivial group. b) Let F = F(x1, x2, x3) and Ri = ⟨ri⟩F. Is it true that the group F/[R1, R2] is residually soluble? R. Mikhailov
answer: b) No, not always (V. A. Roman’kov, Siberian Math. J., 52, no. 2 (2011), 348–351).
